text.name: sys_description
text.text: The 'Atari 8-bits' family is a series of personal computers launched by Atari in 1979. Based on a 6502 processor at 1.79 Mhz, Atari are the first to add a coprocessor allowing it to display a resolution of 384 pixels by Line in 256 colors and 4-way sound. Those were to compete with the Apple II, the Commodore PET and the TRS-80. The first two models, the 400 and the 800 come out respectively with 16 and 48 KB of RAM and 4 joystick ports. They will be re designated in 1983 and 1985 with the XL and XE series which will only remove 2 joystick ports and go to 64 and 128 KB of RAM.
